title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to North Korea
summary:
The document is a notice regarding the continuation of the national emergency declared by the President on June 26, 2008, concerning North Korea. This emergency was established due to the threat posed by the proliferation of weapons-usable fissile material on the Korean Peninsula and has been expanded multiple times through subsequent executive orders in response to North Korea's actions, including missile tests, nuclear developments, and serious human rights abuses.

The President has determined that the ongoing actions and policies of the North Korean government continue to present an unusual and extraordinary threat to U.S. national security, foreign policy, and economy. As a result, the national emergency will remain in effect for another year beyond June 26, 2025.

Key implications of this continuation include the sustained restrictions on North Korea and the acknowledgment of its destabilizing activities, which threaten not only the U.S. but also its allies in the region. The ongoing state of emergency reflects the U.S. government's commitment to addressing the challenges posed by North Korea's nuclear ambitions and its violations of international law.
